vague_description: An institution is trying to optimize its budget allocation for necessary supplies while meeting specific demand and supply constraints.
detailed_description: A hospital purchases two pills available for the patients to take one at a time. One pill is taken as a prevention and another is taken for treatment. The prevention pill takes \param{PreventionPillCost} dollars to make while the treatment pill takes \param{TreatmentPillCost} dollars to make. Since the prevention pill is in higher demand, the hospital must purchase at least \param{PreventionTreatmentRatio} times as many prevention pills as treatment pills. In addition, the hospital must purchase at least \param{MinTreatmentPills} treatment pills. If the clinic only has a budget of \param{Budget} dollars, maximize the number of patients that can be treated.
target_objective: Maximize the number of patients that can be treated
target_constraints: The number of prevention pills must be at least PreventionTreatmentRatio times the number of treatment pills
At least MinTreatmentPills treatment pills must be purchased
The total cost must not exceed the budget Budget dollars
The numbers of prevention and treatment pills are non-negative
target_parameters: Cost to make one prevention pill
Cost to make one treatment pill
Minimum ratio of prevention pills to treatment pills
Minimum number of treatment pills the hospital must purchase
Budget of the hospital for purchasing pills
